intro: Elisanthe akinfijewii, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to arid environments. Elisanthe akinfijewii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
